events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred at a busy intersection causing significant vehicle damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the details of the reported vehicle collision.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the investigation and processing of the customer's auto accident claim.
The claim was formally acknowledged, and the customer was notified that their auto accident case is being reviewed.
The customer was asked to submit police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the claim.
The customer submitted all requested documents including police reports and detailed photos of the accident damage.
The claims team began an in-depth investigation into the circumstances and extent of damage related to the car accident.
Investigation was finalized confirming liability and assessing vehicle damage costs thoroughly for the claim settlement.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the estimated repair costs for the auto accident damages.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed appreciation for the timely processing of their claim.
The claim was officially approved after acceptance of the settlement by the customer and confirmation of documentation.
Payment covering the vehicle repair costs was issued to the customer, completing the financial aspect of the claim.
The auto accident claim file was officially closed following successful payment and resolution of all related matters.
All documentation and records for the closed auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
